parameters.name: func
parameters.description: a function to apply to each member

returnParameters.description: new table containing result of applying parameter `func` to each member

functions.name: 'map
add

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: a predicate to apply to each member to test whether it should be included

returnParameters.description: new table containing members for which parameter `func` evaluates to true

functions.name: filter

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: a function to apply to each member

functions.name: forEach
get

returnParameters.description: true if parameter `t` has a member with key parameter `k`

functions.name: hasKey

returnParameters.description: a new iterator object that will iterate over the members of parameter `t`

functions.name: iterator

returnParameters.description: a new list of all keys

functions.name: keys
length

parameters.name: t
parameters.description: the table with a key of type int

returnParameters.description: an integer not yet used as a key

functions.name: nextKey
functions.description:
Returns the next available integer key.

This is maximum used key value + 1, or 0 if no key used
XXX should it be 0, if the maximum used key value is < 0?
Provides similar functionality to auto-increment

```ballerina
table<record {|readonly int id; string name;|}> key(id) users = table [
    {id: 1, name: "Jo"},
    {id: 2, name: "Sam"}
];
users.nextKey() ⇒ 3
```

functions.name: put

parameters.name: initial
parameters.description: initial value for the first argument of combining parameter `func`

returnParameters.description: result of combining the members of parameter `t` using parameter `func`

functions.name: reduce
functions.description:
Combines the members of a table using a combining function.

The combining function takes the combined value so far and a member of the table,
and returns a new combined value.

```ballerina
table<record {int id; int salary;}> employees = table [
    {id: 1, salary: 1200},
    {id: 2, salary: 1100},
    {id: 3, salary: 800}
];
employees.reduce(isolated function (int total, record {int id; int salary;} next) returns int => total + next.salary, 0) ⇒ 3100
```

returnParameters.description: the member of parameter `t` that had key parameter `k`

functions.name: remove
removeAll

returnParameters.description: the member of parameter `t` that had key parameter `k`, or `()` if parameter `t` does not have a key parameter `k`

functions.name: removeIfHasKey

returnParameters.description: an array whose members are the members of parameter `t`

functions.name: toArray
functions.description:
Returns a list of all the members of a table.

```ballerina
table [
    {code: "CAN", name: "Canada"},
    {code: "DNK", name: "Denmark"},
    {code: "NPL", name: "Nepal"}
].toArray() ⇒ [{"code":"CAN","name":"Canada"},{"code":"DNK","name":"Denmark"},{"code":"NPL","name":"Nepal"}]
```

types.name: KeyType
types.description:
A type parameter that is a subtype of `anydata`.
Has the special semantic that when used in a declaration
all uses in the declaration must refer to same type.

types.name: Type
types.description:
A type parameter that is a subtype of `any|error`.
Has the special semantic that when used in a declaration
all uses in the declaration must refer to same type.

modules.summary: The `lang.table` module corresponds to the `table` basic type.
modules.description:
## Module overview

The `lang.table` module corresponds to the `table` basic type.

functions.description:
Returns the next available integer key.

This is maximum used key value + 1, or 0 if no key used
XXX should it be 0, if the maximum used key value is < 0?
Provides similar functionality to auto-increment

```ballerina
table<record {|readonly int id; string name;|}> key(id) users = table [
    {id: 1, name: "Jo"},
    {id: 2, name: "Sam"}
];
users.nextKey() ⇒ 3
```

Combines the members of a table using a combining function.

The combining function takes the combined value so far and a member of the table,
and returns a new combined value.

```ballerina
table<record {int id; int salary;}> employees = table [
    {id: 1, salary: 1200},
    {id: 2, salary: 1100},
    {id: 3, salary: 800}
];
employees.reduce(isolated function (int total, record {int id; int salary;} next) returns int => total + next.salary, 0) ⇒ 3100
```

Returns a list of all the members of a table.

```ballerina
table [
    {code: "CAN", name: "Canada"},
    {code: "DNK", name: "Denmark"},
    {code: "NPL", name: "Nepal"}
].toArray() ⇒ [{"code":"CAN","name":"Canada"},{"code":"DNK","name":"Denmark"},{"code":"NPL","name":"Nepal"}]
```
